legacyCollection.name: Europe
legacyCollection.longDescription: The latest news, analysis and investigations from Europe.

headline.default: Fears Are Mounting That Ukraine War Will Spill Across Borders

bylines.renderedRepresentation: By David E. Sanger and Steven Erlanger

node.summary: American and European officials say their concern is based in part on a growing conviction that the war will not end any time soon.

headline.default: I.C.C. Joins Investigation of War Crimes in Ukraine

node.summary: Karim Khan, the chief prosecutor of the International Criminal Court, said that his organization would participate in a joint effort — with Ukraine, Poland and Lithuania — to investigate war crimes committed since Russia’s invasion.

headline.default: Ukraine War Impact Widens: Russia Cuts Gas Flow and Vows More Reprisals

bylines.renderedRepresentation: By Matina Stevis-Gridneff, Neil MacFarquhar, Shashank Bengali and Megan Specia

node.summary: New explosions across Ukraine’s borders, Russia’s shut-off of natural gas to two European nations and Moscow’s warning of additional “counterstrikes” pointed to escalating hostilities.

headline.default: House Passes Bill Urging Biden to Sell Seized Russian Yachts to Aid Ukraine

node.summary: The measure is mostly symbolic, but the top Senate Democrat is pressing to use a coming Ukraine aid spending bill to give the president the power to liquidate the confiscated property.

headline.default: Endgame Nears in Bidding for Chelsea F.C.

node.summary: The American bank selling the English soccer team on behalf of its Russian owner could name its preferred suitor by the end of the week. But the drama isn’t over.
